title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that total revenue will decrease and/or does not explain that demand is price elastic in this price range; or use numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1, or the total revenue decreases.

The response states that total revenue will decrease and explains that demand is price elastic in this price range; or uses numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1, or the total revenue decreases.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, the firm is producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and/or does not explain that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 120 units).

The response states that yes, the firm is producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and explains that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 120 units).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at 90 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and/or does not explain that the price is above the ATC.
The response states that at 90 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and explains that the price is above the ATC.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that at 60 units marginal cost is less than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is lower than the average total cost, which pulls down the average total cost for the next unit.

The response explains that at 60 units marginal cost is less than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is lower than the average total cost, which pulls down the average total cost for the next unit.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the consumer surplus as $270 and/or does not show the work:
